column3: Great job passing all the autotests!
Nice choice of base cases!
Nice use of in-line comments!
In-line comments are required for complex code.
Accumulation does not happen in variables so much in recursion as it does in the return statements. No need to declare an accumulator variable at top of function.
Base case should catch when num is less than 10, then return that num!
Don't convert the num to a str. Use // and % arithmetic instead.
Needs to return the sum of the digits.
Code could have one fewer recursive call if base case is for one digit number & return num, rather than 0.
Base case should check that there's fewer than 2 characters and return empty list.
Second base case of 2 characters isn't needed.
Needs to return a list of strings representing the story.
Function should be invariant, return it to where it started!
Base case should check that size < gap*2, don't draw anything & return 0.
Needs to return the number squares drawn, one per function frame!
While function would draw correctly without being invariant, the lab doc asked that turtle return to where it started! This explains the TestResults error.
Function should be invariant, return it to where it started!
Base case should check that quilt is less than patch_size, draw last square & return 1.
Needs to return number squares drawn, 2 per function frame, plus whatever the recursive calls draw!
quilt_size//2 used often enough, it could be a good variable.
Need to draw quilt as quadrants (2 separate small squares + 2 nested quilts), not one big square! (Otherwise, why add 2 to the return count?)
Good job making this one invariant!
Function should be invariant, return it to where it started!
Base case should check that branch is less than min, and return 0.
Need to return _length_ of branches drawn, one per function frame!
This stems from a <= instead of a < base case condition. Not an issue.
